link.title: It's not just the fans, Samsung's chairman is also mad at the Apple-inspired designs
link.desc: "The internal atmosphere is currently very bad." I'm all for companies copying the good ideas from each other, but the level to which Samsung copies other brands, specially Apple recently, has been pretty egregious for a long time. Wonder if this will spur a change.

link.title: The misleading controversy over an Olympic women's boxing match, briefly explained
link.desc: When terfs don't recognise a cisgender woman as a woman, it's not about "protecting women" as they say, it's about gatekeeping what one is to their narrow-minded vision of one.

link.title: 'Google Is a Monopolist,' Judge Rules in Landmark Antitrust Case
link.desc: This has been clear for a while, but what now? I try, try to use DuckDuckGo when I can but it's just not always as good.

link.title: The Circular Tube Map Is Back - New And Improved
link.desc: I do love this thing. I don't agree that it's quite as practical as the designer says, I don't think it would work as a travel booklet, but printed nice and big it's really beautiful.

link.title: Apple Maps on the web launches in beta
link.desc: It's been in a Safari-only beta for a little while, but seems to work in everything now. Somewhat barebones but here's hoping it'll get better.
